string-array.name: list1_sentences
string-array.item: The pilot will fly a new airplane to Europe and back beginning next week.
Mark will answer the email he got next week, but he doesn\'t know what to write.
Kim will display the photos she took next month, but she won\'t show all of them.
Joseph brewed the beer he will serve next week, but it is not very tasty.
David caught the fish he will cook tomorrow, but it is not his favourite kind.
Anne will serve the apples she picked yesterday, but she won\'t serve the plums.
The children of the rich man were spoiled, but they were charming and handsome.
The son of the actress who shot herself on the set was under investigation.
The sister of the salesman who made a fool of himself at work was very angry.
The aunt of the schoolboy who hurt himself was concerned about the injury.
The son of the princess who scratched himself in public was awfully embarrassed.
The sister of the prince who injured himself falling off a roof was still sad.
The gardener was happy with the flowers, but the owner of the house was not.
The son of the lady who politely introduced herself was popular at the party.
The teacher praised the girl and her family was proud of her good grades.
The police arrested the burglar and his brother phoned a lawyer for help.
The brother of the schoolgirl who burned herself was usually very careful.
The boy who was wearing a blue cap went missing on his way home last week.
Amy will visit the man she worked with last month, but she is nervous about it.
Dan wrote the speech he will deliver next month, but he hasn\'t practiced it yet.
Tom will plant the tree he bought last week, but he isn\'t sure where to put it.
The witness identified the man and his wife ran away from the police station.
The aunt of the waiter who trained herself to cook wanted to own a restaurant.
The tourist photographed the swimmer, and the runner got ready for the race.
Jim listened to the pianist, and the singer watched the organist at the concert.
The father of the pretty girl cleaned up the house all by himself last week.
Yesterday, the wife of the politician discussed health care with old people.
The niece of the fisherman who got herself a sailboat learned to sail.
The nephew of the maid who cut himself with the knife called the doctor.
The juggler entertained the children, and their parents drank wine at the party.
The infant was able to stand by himself for the first time last week.
The grandma of the policeman who educated herself at night became a teacher.
The cute girl who was on the cover of the magazine became a famous doctor.
The nurse examined the mother, and the child played quietly in the corner.
The actress yelled at the cameraman and the director hurried out of the room.
The brother of the ballerina who found himself in a lot of trouble phoned home.
The audience applauded the guitarist, and the band cheered for him very loudly.
Mary called the applicant she will interview yesterday, but there was no answer.
Susan bought the wine she will drink last week, but she didn\'t buy any cheese.
The journalist criticized Nick and Sam called the newspaper to complain.
Judy cooked in the kitchen, and Richard barbecued outside in the yard.
Julie dated Adam and Andy, but she married Jeff in Las Vegas last month.
Jim painted the picture he will display last month, but he isn\'t happy with it.
Jane and John studied math and history yesterday, but they failed the exams.
James will fix the car he drove tomorrow, but he will need some help.
Diane hugged her boyfriend, and her friend felt uncomfortable watching them.
The woman could not find Bill and his girlfriend became nervous and upset.
The nurse took care of the old lady who could not take care of herself.
The robber shot the jeweller and the salesman reported the crime to the police.
Jenny talked to the reporter and the photographer took pictures of the scene.
Bill will quit his job next month to take care of his kids and step-children.
Robert will meet the friend he phoned yesterday, but he doesn\'t want to.
The thief noticed the boy and the girl watching him from the upstairs window.
Sue insulted the candidate she will debate tomorrow, but she wishes she hadn\'t.
Jane prepared the lecture she will give next week, but still needs to review it.
Hugh took too long to propose, and his girlfriend decided to marry someone else.
Lisa will change the plans she made last week, but she won\'t cancel any of them.
Jeff planned the party he will hold next month, but he hasn\'t sent invitations.
Paul will marry the woman he just met last month, but the wedding will be small.
The old man amused himself by gossiping with his children and friends.
Linda will wear the sweater she washed tomorrow, but she won\'t wear her skirt.
Mike watered the flower he will sell yesterday, but he forgot to water the bush.
Chris cleaned the bookcase he will sell last week, but it is still very dusty.
Cathy will burn the wood she gathered next week, but she will save some of it.
John hired the clerk he will promote last month, but he fired another employee.
Bob will complete the project he started next month, but Fred won\'t finish his.
The student who was running out of money gave himself a haircut last week.
The woman dressed her baby, and her son got his clothes from the dresser.
The boyfriend of the model was killed in an accident while skiing last week.
Todd wanted to be a barber, but his shaky hands prevented him from becoming one.
Margo will open bakeries in Chicago and New York after getting a loan next year.
The brother of the bride who embarrassed herself at the wedding felt ashamed.
The uncle of the waitress who hurt herself was shocked by the accident.
The grandfather of the woman who killed herself last summer had been to prison.
The grandma of the fireman who criticized himself far too often was anxious.
The daughter of the man who complimented himself in public was beautiful.
Sarah and her mother had steak, potatoes, and green beans for dinner last night.
The daughter of the actor who hated himself for failing always seemed unhappy.
Cindy treated herself to a vacation in China and several other Asian countries.
The writer of the novels thought himself to be a genius, but he wasn\'t.
The grandfather of the policewoman who treated himself so badly was troubled.
The nephew of the queen who praised himself all the time was very rude.
The uncle of the girl who prepared himself for the race was a great athlete.
The daughter of the king who devoted herself to the kingdom was never emotional.
The sister of the boy who taught herself advanced mathematics was very smart.
The niece of the butler who scolded herself for losing the key was very upset.
Megan got angry with her boss and sued him for discrimination last month.
The swimmer disappointed her coach, and her mother tried to console her.
The little girl fed her pet cat, and her dog wanted a can of food, too.
The ranger gave matches to the camper, and his friend made a fire by the tent.
The producer replaced the actor, and the actress quit the movie after the fight.
The crowd cheered for the model, and the designer took a bow after the show.
Bobby yelled at the teacher and the principal asked his parents for a meeting.
The customer complained about the waiter and the chef gave him a free dessert.
The knight greeted the king and the queen waved to her people at the feast.
Sam hired the plumber and the carpenter ordered the materials for the house.

string-array.name: list1_questions
string-array.item: Will the pilot fly to Europe?
Will Mark answer the email?
Will Kim show all the photos?
Will Joseph serve the beer?
Will David cook the fish?
Will Anne serve the plums?
Were the children of the rich man spoiled?
Was the son of the actress under investigation?
Was the sister of the salesman angry?
Was the schoolboy concerned about the injury?
Was the princess embarrassed?
Was the prince sad?
Was the owner happy with the flowers?
Was the lady popular at the party?
Was the girl\'s family proud of her grades?
Was the burglar arrested?
Was the brother of the schoolgirl usually careful?
Was the boy wearing a blue cap?
Is Amy nervous?
Has Dan practiced the speech?
Does Tom know where to put the tree?
Did the witness run away from the police station?
Did the waiter want to own a restaurant?
Did the tourist photograph the runner?
Did the singer listen to the pianist?
Did the pretty girl clean the house?
Did the politician discuss health care?
Did the niece of the fisherman learn to sail?
Did the nephew of the maid call the doctor?
Did the juggler drink wine?
Did the infant stand by himself last week?
Did the grandma of the policeman become a teacher?
Did the cute girl become a doctor?
Did the child play quietly?
Did the cameraman hurry out of the room?
Did the ballerina phone home?
Did the audience applaud the guitarist?
Did the applicant answer?
Did Susan buy any cheese?
Did Sam call the newspaper?
Did Richard barbecue in the yard?
Did Julie marry Adam?
Did Jim paint the picture?
Did Jane and John pass the exams?
Did James drive a car?
Did Diane\'s friend feel uncomfortable?
Could the woman find Bill?
Could the old lady take care of herself?
